text: The PR2 mixed double sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-eight finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Paralympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 25 August 2019 || 09:30 || Heats |- | Tuesday 27 August 2019 || 11:13 || Repechage |- | Thursday 29 August 2019 || 11:02 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=2|Saturday 31 August 2019 || 10:48 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 13:05 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== The three fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechage. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Annika van der Meer Corne de Koning | align="left"| | 8:28.09 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Josiane Lima Michel Pessanha | align="left"| | 8:50.54 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Liu Shuang Jiang Jijian | align="left"| | 9:31.62 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Inés Felipe Jorge Pineda | align="left"| | 11:23.08 | R |- | – | align="left"|Numtip Sinchai Voranipit Boonmark | align="left"| | | |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Perle Bouge Christophe Lavigne | align="left"| | 8:28.14 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Svitlana Bohuslavska Iaroslav Koiuda | align="left"| | 8:33.18 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Egor Frolov Irina Kriukova | align="left"| | 9:01.86 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Jessye Brockway Jeremy Hall | align="left"| | 9:05.73 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Otabek Kuchkorov Gulchiroy Esanbaeva | align="left"| | 10:02.54 | R |} ====Heat 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Lauren Rowles Laurence Whiteley | align="left"| | 8:13.86 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Michał Gadowski Jolanta Majka | align="left"| | 8:31.55 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Laura Goodkind Russell Gernaat | align="left"| | 8:50.32 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Amalia Sedlmayr Marcus Klemp | align="left"| | 9:11.34 | R |} ===Repechage=== The three fastest boats advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boat took no further part in the competition. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Amalia Sedlmayr Marcus Klemp | align="left"| | 8:53.20 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Jessye Brockway Jeremy Hall | align="left"| | 9:12.80 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Otabek Kuchkorov Gulchiroy Esanbaeva | align="left"| | 9:37.24 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Inés Felipe Jorge Pineda | align="left"| | 10:48.97 | |} ===Semifinals=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Annika van der Meer Corne de Koning | align="left"| | 8:11.58 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Perle Bouge Christophe Lavigne | align="left"| | 8:21.26 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Michał Gadowski Jolanta Majka | align="left"| | 8:25.49 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Egor Frolov Irina Kriukova | align="left"| | 8:47.67 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Otabek Kuchkorov Gulchiroy Esanbaeva | align="left"| | 9:20.58 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Amalia Sedlmayr Marcus Klemp | align="left"| | 9:52.09 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Lauren Rowles Laurence Whiteley | align="left"| | 8:07.33 | FA, '''''' |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Svitlana Bohuslavska Iaroslav Koiuda | align="left"| | 8:21.73 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Josiane Lima Michel Pessanha | align="left"| | 8:26.98 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Liu Shuang Jiang Jijian | align="left"| | 8:37.54 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Laura Goodkind Russell Gernaat | align="left"| | 8:41.30 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Jessye Brockway Jeremy Hall | align="left"| | 8:53.21 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the B final. ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Liu Shuang Jiang Jijian | align="left"| | 8:49.14 |- | 2 | align="left"|Laura Goodkind Russell Gernaat | align="left"| | 8:54.42 |- | 3 | align="left"|Amalia Sedlmayr Marcus Klemp | align="left"| | 8:59.65 |- | 4 | align="left"|Egor Frolov Irina Kriukova | align="left"| | 9:00.22 |- | 5 | align="left"|Jessye Brockway Jeremy Hall | align="left"| | 9:04.80 |- | 6 | align="left"|Otabek Kuchkorov Gulchiroy Esanbaeva | align="left"| | 10:04.98 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Lauren Rowles Laurence Whiteley | align="left"| | 8:34.95 |- | | align="left"|Annika van der Meer Corne de Koning | align="left"| | 8:37.78 |- | | align="left"|Perle Bouge Christophe Lavigne | align="left"| | 9:02.60 |- | 4 | align="left"|Svitlana Bohuslavska Iaroslav Koiuda | align="left"| | 9:06.25 |- | 5 | align="left"|Josiane Lima Michel Pessanha | align="left"| | 9:13.16 |- | 6 | align="left"|Michał Gadowski Jolanta Majka | align="left"| | 9:18.92 |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships
